column1: One day Lisa was alone in the house. Her sister had gone away to spend the day
column2: and her father was out fishing. A heavy storm came up. It rocked the house
column3: and blew the shutters to and fro; but Lisa never heeded it
column4: for she was thinking of her father.After the storm had ceased
column5: she went to the door and looked out. An old fisherman was passing with his son. She asked him about her father. He pointed out the place where he had seen him before the storm
column7: "I fear that your father's boat has been driven upon the rocks
column8: for it is no longer to be seen."Without a moment's delay
column10: and hastened down to the shore. She got into a boat
column12: when an old sailor stopped her
column13: and asked her where she was going.
